DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to compare the effectiveness of two wound dressings, Acticoat Absorbent (AA) and BCT Antimicrobial (BCT) on Split Thickness Skin Graft (STSG) donor site.
DOC.brief_title: Acticoat Absorbent and BCT Antimicrobial for STSG Donor Site on Thigh
DOC.detailed_description: Seventy patients who undergo STSG procedure in Kaohsiung Veterans General Hospital will be recruited. Two donor sites of equal lengths and widths on the same thigh, which are at least 2 cm apart will be covered randomly with AA and BCT each. Wound healing rate and infection rate will be assessed at 7 and 14 days after surgery. Degrees of pain and itchiness will be assessed daily with Visual Analogue Scale for the first 7 post-operative days. Scar appearance will be assessed with Vancouver Scar Scale 1, 3 and 6 months post-operatively.
